page.title: 01Bourtie
page.content: Much of the parish of Bourtie, roughly 5500 acres, rising to 500 feet or more and consits of predominantly hill farms, but where the land falls between the hills there is good agricultural round where all major crops can be grown. The Burreldale Moss is one area in which the traditional job of peat casting (digging) is still carried on. Although modern farming methods influence the ways of Bourtie farmers, their lifestyle is essentially one of continuing the traditions of father and grandfather and many go regularly to the little church in Kirkton of Bourtie, where services are held on the first and third Sundays of each month. The Kirkton is in fact no more than the kirk (church) the Old Manse (minister's house).
